result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison M. Ganley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **7/26/19 - Probation extended for a period of 6 months.  May be discharged early if proof of CS hours is provided**

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's office on a payment plan set to begin on 10/1/16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office on payment plan as set forth. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must comply with mental health regimen.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

timeConds.notes: Banked jail time to be used by agent if necessary.

25 hours of Community Service per year of probation for a total of 75 hours.
**CS hours amended on 7/26/19 - 15 hours to be completed within the 6 month extension**

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

SENTENCING Ct 1- w/h sent, prob 3 yrs, $290.60 fine/cost, $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample,   No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. comply w/MH regimen, 30 days banked jail for use of agent if necessary. 25 hrs CS for each year of prob- total of 75 hrs. eligible for expunction.
